titleStmt.title: The jovial beggars merry crew. When beggars that have coyn good store, yet still like vagrants live, they do but onely cheat the poor, 'tis pitty them to give Tune of, A figg for France.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for I. Deacon at the Angel in Guilt-spur-street: without Newgate.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Verse: "There was a jovial beggar bold,".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Angel in Guilt-spur-street: without Newgate.
